Header: Withhold Tax on tele dramas will be removed under the instructions of the President
Content: President Maithripala Sirisena has instructed the officials to not to charge the 14 percent of withholding tax on the sale of tele dramas. The President has also instructed Minister of Finance and Mass Media, Mangala Samaraweera to inform the relevant organizations in writing, regarding the measures. A group of artistes and representatives of the cinema and tele drama industries met President Maithripala Sirisena. They explained to the President that due to the new tax policy they will face immense difficulties in continuing their creative work. The President stated that he will provide redress discussing with the Minister of Finance without making disturbance to the newly introduced tax policy. The government is committed to protect the cinema and tele drama industries. The President emphasizes that he is ready to take measures to the betterment of the industries without any hesitation. The President also elaborated about the comprehensive work done by the current government for the sake of the creative industries. A committee has been appointed under the instructions of President Sirisena to inquire about the progressive measures taken by the government to ensure better cinema and tele drama culture in Sri Lanka. Ministers Mangala Samaraweera, Wijeyadasa Rajapakse and Deputy Minister Lasantha Alagiyawanna were present at the discussion.
